headline: Vaginal tightening products ineffective, make sex painful – Experts
summarized_story:
•Say such vagina put men at risk of penile fracture, bruisingSexual health experts have warned women against using products that claim to tighten the vagina, noting that such products rather than increase sexual pleasure make sexual intercourse more painful.
According to the experts, vaginal tightening products do not tighten but rather dry up the vagina making sex painful.
According to the experts, the vaginal tightening products which come in the form of gels, creams, or syrup are not good for the vaginal health of women, noting that women using them are also more prone to infections.
Speaking in the same vein, Amos, who holds a degree in Sexology and Sex Counselling, also warned women who use vaginal tightening products to desist, noting that they risk their vagina feeling dry, painful and uncomfortable during sexual intercourse.
“This cannot only make you prone to contracting infections, your vaginal walls will become irritated, the vagina feels sore and painful,” she said.

headline: Eid-el-Fitr: Sultan declares Monday as Sallah in Nigeria
summarized_story:
Alhaji Sa’ad Abubakar III, the Sultan of Sokoto and President-General, Nigeria Supreme Council for Islamic Affairs (NSCIA), has declared Monday (May 2, 2022) as the first day of Shawwal 1443AH in Nigeria.
“The Sultanate Council Advisory Committee on Religious Affairs in conjunction with the National Moon Sighting Committee did not receive any report from various Moon sighting committees across the country.
“The Sultan has accepted the report and accordingly declared Monday, May 2, 2022, as the first day of Shawwal 1443AH, Day of Eid-el-Fitr,” he said.
The Sultan felicitated Nigerian Muslim Ummah and wished them Allah’s guidance and blessings.
He urged the Muslim Ummah to continue to pray for peace, progress and development of the country while wishing all Nigerians happy Eid-el-Fitr.

headline: Lagos Chamber of Commerce seeks NCC’s partnership on 2022 ICTEL expo
summarized_story:

headline: FG procures fighter jets to fight insecurity – Minister
summarized_story:

Speaking through the Chief of Defence Staff, General Lucky Irabor, in Kaduna on Saturday as 49 new officers were commissioned and 1,549 recruits enlisted into the Nigerian Air Force, the Minister gave the names of the aircrafts as the DA-42 surveillance aircraft, A109 Trekker helicopters and Beechcraft KA-360i aircraft.
The Minister enjoined the military to do all it could to protect the lives and property of Nigerians at this moment of various security challenges bedevilling the country.
According to the Minister, the military profession, which they have chosen, requires absolute discipline, loyalty and hard work, among other virtues, adding that it is much more than just a job, especially at this crucial time in the nation’s history, when they are battling the challenges of insecurity on several fronts.
He stated, “As such, you are expected to secure the lives and properties of the Nigerian people and ensure that they can live in peace and pursue their legitimate aspirations without fear.

headline: Eid-ul-Fitr: No moon sighted as fasting continues in Saudi Arabia
summarized_story:
Ramadan fasting continues in Saudi Arabia as the 2023 Shawwal moon is yet to be sighted as earlier projected, Daily Trust reports.
The development indicates that since fasting continues on Sunday, the Eid-ul-Fitr would probably take place on Monday.
Nigerian Supreme Council for Islamic Affairs (NSCIA) had in a statement, urged Muslim faithful to be on the look out for moon on Saturday.
The President General of NSCIA, and Sultan of Sokoto, Alhaji Muhammad Sa’ad Abubakar III said the moon, if sighted on Saturday, would mean Sunday is a day of ‘Idul Fitr.
However, if the crescent is not sighted that day, then Monday, May 2nd 2022, automatically becomes the day of ‘Idul Fitr”, the statement added.

headline: Real Madrid win 35th La Liga title
summarized_story:
After a 4-0 win over Espanyol, Spanish giants Real Madrid secured their 35th La Liga title on Saturday.
A brace by Rodrygo and a goal apiece from Marco Asensio and Karim Benzema ensured they wrapped things up with four games to spare.
Though they needed only a draw to win the title, it took 33 minutes for Rodrygo to open the scoring.
The Brazilian added a second 10 minutes later with a fine finish in a dominant display at the Bernabéu.
Asensio’s strike allowed Carlo Ancelotti to rest players as they prepare for their Champions League semi-final second leg against Manchester City on Wednesday before Benzema finished things off to leave Madrid uncatchable at the top.

headline: Buhari Receives Oba of Benin in State House, Says Germany to Return 1,130 Looted Bronzes
summarized_story:

The Royal Majesty was at State House to thank the President on the recent return of two important Benin Bronzes to its original place of abode by the University of Cambridge and the University of Aberdeen, both in the United Kingdom, after 125 years.
Speaking on the return of the artefacts, President Buhari expressed delight that it had brought immense goodwill and acclaim to Nigeria, the ancient Benin Kingdom as well as happiness to the Oba of Benin.

A British lawmaker suspended by Prime Minister Boris Johnson’s Conservative Party following accusations that he watched pornography on his phone in the House of Commons debating chamber has said he opened the explicit content in error.
Neil Parish was suspended as a Conservative lawmaker on Friday after reporting himself to parliament’s standards commissioner.
He has said he will continue as a member of parliament while an investigation is carried out.
“It was all very embarrassing,” the newspaper quoted Sue Parish as saying.
“People shouldn’t be looking at pornography.

headline: Ukraine Says Russia Pounding Donbas, Failing to Take Targets
summarized_story:
Russian forces pounded Ukraine’s eastern Donbas region on Saturday but failed to capture three target areas, Ukraine’s military said, while Moscow said Western sanctions on Russia and arms shipments to Ukraine were impeding peace negotiations.
Ukraine accuses Russian troops of atrocities in areas near the capital, Kyiv, that they previously occupied.
Mykola Lukashuk, head of the Dnipro regional council, said Russian forces had shelled the outskirts of Velyka Kostromka in the Kryvyi Rih area.
Ukraine dismisses Putin’s claims of persecution and says it is fighting an unprovoked land grab to fully capture Donetsk and Luhansk, which form the Donbas region.
Western officials said Russia had suffered fewer casualties after narrowing the scale of its invasion but that numbers were still “quite high”.

headline: Nigeria: 68 Abducted Train Passengers Spend Day 34 in the Dungeon of Terrorists, Freedom Still Not in Sight, Families Frustrated
summarized_story:
Last Tuesday, the terrorists released three new photos showing 62 of the abducted passengers, including children and women.
Three weeks back, the terrorists released a two-minute video, showing scores of abductees sitting in a forest, including men, women and children.
Some of the elderly among the abducted passengers are clearly experiencing deteriorating health conditions.
A disturbed relative told THISDAY last Thursday that his uncle was among the abducted passengers and that his health was worsening.
The terrorists insist that they are not after a ransom, but an exchange of the abducted passengers with their commanders, who were in government custody.

headline: As Germany Plans to Return 1,130 Looted Benin Bronzes to Nigeria, Buhari Backs Ultramodern Royal Museum at Oba of Benin’s Palace
summarized_story:
President Muhammadu Buhari on Friday backed the planned ultramodern international standard Benin Royal Museum that would house the Benin Bronzes and other artefacts being returned to Nigeria, for the purpose of preserving history, tourism and education.
The President announced his support while receiving in audience at the State House, Abuja, the Oba of Benin, H.R.M.
Omo N’Oba Uku Akpolokpolo Ewuare II, accompanied by members of the Royal Court of Benin and the Board of Trustees of the Benin Royal Museum.
When concluded, it will signify the return to Nigeria by Germany of all the 1,130 Benin Bronzes in Germany’s public museums.
‘‘Furthermore, on the 7th of this month, the Glasgow City Council agreed to return 17 Benin Bronzes to Nigeria.
